data.title: Lakehead University Rankings, Courses, Fees, Admission 2023 & Scholarships
data.meta_description: Lakehead University rankings, programs, and admission process. View cost of attendance, scholarships, and other crucial details.
data.text:
Lakehead University is a provincially supported public research university. The university was established in June 4, 1946 and founded by an Order-in-Council of the Province of Ontario. The university has its campuses in Thunder Bay and Orillia, Ontario, Canada. Lakehead University has been recognised by the Times higher Education as one of the top Universities in the year 2022. Explore: Lakehead University Student Profile

Lakehead University courses are offered across the subject areas like Medicine, Engineering, Business Administration etc. The Social Science and Humanities department is the largest department of the university with over 30% enrollment. The Thunder Bay campus is its main campus and the 2nd campus i.e., the Orillia campus is the LU celebrating it’s 10-year anniversary.

International students need a minimum academic grade of 70-75% for admission to Lakehead. Students need a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 or equivalent to get enrolled at Lakehead. The cost of pursuing the undergraduate programs at Lakehead University ranges between 15 to 28 lakhs INR. Graduate programs at Lakehead University may cost between 4 to 7 lakhs INR. The cost of living for Indian students vary between 7-9 lakhs INR.

Lakehead University Rankings

Lakehead University has performed really well in the last few years. Here’s a glimpse of the Lakehead University’s Rankings:

#64 in Impact Rankings, 2022 according to Times Higher Education

#801-1000 in World University Rankings, 2022 according to Times Higher Education

#1279 in Best Global Universities according to U.S. News and World Report, 2022

#32 in Best Global Universities in Canada by U.S. News and World Report, 2022

Lakehead University Courses

The University offers a range of courses to choose from, there are undergraduate, postgraduate, doctoral, diploma and other certificate courses available across its campuses in Thunder Bay and Orillia. The mode of delivery of the courses might vary, it might be online and offline depending on the choice of the candidate plus due to the global pandemic there has been a shift in the education platform from on-campus course to online mode.

LU offers almost 57 undergraduate and 30 graduate and doctoral programs including courses like Medicine, Engineering, Business Administration etc.

Along with the 30 UG and 30 PG courses, LU also offers doctoral, diploma and certificate courses.

Some of the top programs at Lakehead University are as follows:

Lakehead University Campus

Lakehead University is spread over 2 campuses, namely:

Thunder Bay Campus

The first building was opened in the year 1957

Thunder Bay is the main campus of Lakehead University, located in the North-western Ontario.

Orillia Campus

The Lakehead University opened a campus in Downtown Orillia in the year 2006 with about 100 students in the first semester.

This academic building represented the first phase in the development of Canada’s first LEED.

Both the campuses are situated in beautiful towns in Canada and offer a magnificent weather and view. The University provides students with opportunities that offer self growth and make a healthy minded Individual.

The University also has a student governing body called LUSU (Lakehead University Student Union) that manages Student-run Clubs. A variety of clubs like athletics, cultural, debate etc are formed in the University.

Lakehead University Residence

Living away from home isn’t as easy or fun as it seems. To facilitate the stay of students wanting to study in Canada the University provides both on-campus and off-campus accommodations at affordable prices.

On-Campus Housing

LU provides on-campus accommodation to it’s students in both Orillia and Thunder Bay.

Students are provided with furnished bedrooms with all the basic utilities like proper electricity, proper water supply and internet access.

Home residence is a perfect choice for newcomers who do not have any prior experience to living alone.

Home residence comes with full meal plans in the accommodation package so that candidates can focus on their education full time and give time to them for proper self-growth.

The Thunder Bay residence has a total of 1,196 beds with three cafeteria and dining hall.

Students have an option to choose meal plans depending on the place they come from.

Off-Campus Housing

Off campus accommodation is available with a walking distance of 5 min away from the campus.

Off campus accommodation is best for candidates who are looking for an independent mode of accommodation.

Both the campuses of Lakehead University are situated in small towns and it is not much of a big deal to find cheap and affordable rent.

Apartments are available both shared and single occupancy and facilities like kitchen, AC, access to the internet are all provided within the accommodations.

Lakehead University is a place to live and dream. With a dynamic, modern and highly learner-centered environment that acknowledges all of it’s students as valued leaders of tomorrow.

Also, know about the best cities to live in Canada.

Lakehead University Application Process

Lakehead University admissions take place in 3 intake cycles, i.e., in September, January and in May or July. The deadlines for the undergraduate programs for international students are March 1, 2021 (full-time and part-time) and April 1, 2021 (Summer) though they are still accepting the applications.

Application Steps: Following are the steps required for admission to LU:

The first step is to visit the official website of the University.

Fill in the required details and select the program you want to opt for.

Wait for the acknowledgement from the University and keep checking the official site.

Undergraduate Admission Requirements:

A minimum of 70% in secondary school is required (Canadian Equivalent)

English proficiency test score:

IELTS academic: Overall 6.5, with no section less than 6.0

TOEFL iBT: Overall 80, with no section less than 19

PTE: Overall 58, with no section below 50

Graduate Admission Requirements:

Candidates must be graduates from a recognised University that is candidates must have a bachelor’s degree.

A minimum score of 75% is required or a 3 on 4 point according to Canadian scale.

English proficiency test scores:

TOEFL iBT: 80

IELTS: 6.5

Note: There might be program-specific admission requirements for distinct graduate courses at Lakehead University.

Lakehead University Cost of Attendance

The Cost of Attendance varies from course to course. But the Tuition fees for Canadian students is lesser than the international students because the Ontario government bears some of the educational expenses of students of Canada. Usually undergrad programs are more expensive than Post Grad programs.

Undergraduate courses take anywhere from 15.5 lakhs to 27.42 lakhs INR per year on just tuition fees whereas the postgraduate courses take anywhere from 4.27 lakhs to 6.67 lakhs INR. The accommodation expenses or the cost of living to study in Lakehead University is tabulated below:

Know in detail the cost of living in Canada.

Lakehead University Scholarships

The University offers financial aid to students who excel in their entrance examination and the university offers one top scholarship programs applicable to both local and international students.

LU spends more than INR 60,91,24,725 that is around 10,028,287 CAD on scholarships and awards to help students pursue their dream. Scholarships are awarded to the top 2 international students and graduate assistant appointments are offered to some of the full-time and graduate students.

However, scholarship varies for international and local students. For international students, the entrance scholarship is valued at INR 3,69,274 that is 6077 CAD but if the student continues to excel in academics the financial aid can be extended to 4 years valued at INR 14,77,116 i.e., 24300 CAD to INR 22,15,644 i.e., 36,400 CAD.

Additionally, students can look for a plethora of international scholarships to study in Canada.

Lakehead University Alumni

Lakehead University, more likely known as LU has over 45,000 alumni, with the main campus at Thunder Bay with about 7,900 students. The University also has an Alumni Association which supports the University through funding. Some of the notable alumni include:
